H2446.def: = man; ► father of {L:Nehemiah<SDBH:נְחֶמְיָה>}, governor of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, after exile

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3691.def: = month, equivalent to period November/December; ► post-exilic

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1002.def: = a fortress that commands a city and is used in the control of the inhabitants and in defense during attack or siege.

H7800.def: = a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone-shaped flowers, usually with 5-6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H6413.def: = a group of people who were able to flee from danger

H3064.def: = language ◄ spoken by people of the kingdom of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

72.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4082.def: = an adminstrative division of a country or a city

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H3341.def: = action by which someone causes something to start burning, usually with effects on people and nature around; ≈ associated with punishment and judgement

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6684.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H6419.def: = state in which humans regard an event as likely to happen

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H577.def: = marker introducing a very humble request

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6419.def: = state in which humans regard an event as likely to happen

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H2389.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H4945.def: = a liquid for humans to drink

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
